00020 #include <stdexcept>

00022 #include <com/xuggle/ferry/JNIHelper.h>
00023 #include <com/xuggle/ferry/Logger.h>

00025 #include <com/xuggle/xuggler/io/URLProtocolHandler.h>

00027 using namespace com::xuggle::ferry;

00029 VS_LOG_SETUP(VS_CPP_PACKAGE);
00030 
00031 static void URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(JNIEnv *env)
00032 {
00033   if (env) {
00034     jthrowable exception = env->ExceptionOccurred();
00035     if (exception)
00036     {
00037       JNIHelper *helper = JNIHelper::getHelper();
00038       if (helper &&
00039           !helper->isInterrupted() &&
00040           helper->isInterruptedException(exception))
00041         // preserve the interrupt
00042         helper->interrupt();
00043       
00044       //env->ExceptionDescribe();
00045       
00046       // Clear the pending exception.  This is necessary because
00047       // other JNI methods may need to be called afterwards to 
00048       // clean up the IO condition.  This means our URL
00049       // protocolhandler is eating an exception, but them's the breaks.
00050       env->ExceptionClear();
00051       
00052       // free the local reference
00053       env->DeleteLocalRef(exception);
00054       
00055       // and throw back to caller
00056       throw std::runtime_error("got java exception");
00057     }
00058   }
00059 }
00060 namespace com { namespace xuggle{ namespace xuggler { namespace io
00061 {
00062 URLProtocolHandler::URLProtocolHandler(const char * protoName,
00063     jobject aJavaProtocolHandler)
00064 {
00065   // We can assume that protoName will outlive this class, so
00066   // we don't need to copy it.
00067   mProtoName = protoName;
00068 
00069   cacheJavaMethods(aJavaProtocolHandler);
00070 }
00071 
00072 URLProtocolHandler::~URLProtocolHandler()
00073 {
00074   if (mJavaProtoHandler)
00075   {
00076     JNIHelper::sDeleteGlobalRef(mJavaProtoHandler);
00077     mJavaProtoHandler = NULL;
00078 
00079     // now all of our other Java refers are invalid as well.
00080   }
00081 }
00082 void URLProtocolHandler::cacheJavaMethods(jobject aProtoHandler)
00083 {
00084   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00085 
00086   mJavaProtoHandler = env->NewGlobalRef(aProtoHandler);
00087 
00088   // I don't make GlobalRefs to all of this because
00089   // (as I understand it) these method referenes will remain
00090   // valid as long as the mJavaProtoHandler lives.
00091   // it should also be good across threads, but to be honest,
00092   // this class does not support a protocol handler being
00093   // used on multiple threads.
00094   jclass cls = env->GetObjectClass(aProtoHandler);
00095 
00096   mJavaUrlOpen_mid
00097       = env->GetMethodID(cls, "open", "(Ljava/lang/String;I)I");
00098   mJavaUrlClose_mid = env->GetMethodID(cls, "close", "()I");
00099   mJavaUrlRead_mid = env->GetMethodID(cls, "read", "([BI)I");
00100   mJavaUrlWrite_mid = env->GetMethodID(cls, "write", "([BI)I");
00101   mJavaUrlSeek_mid = env->GetMethodID(cls, "seek", "(JI)J");
00102   mJavaUrlIsStreamed_mid = env->GetMethodID(cls, "isStreamed",
00103       "(Ljava/lang/String;I)Z");
00104 
00105 }
00106 
00107 int URLProtocolHandler::url_open(URLContext *h, const char *url, int flags)
00108 {
00109   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00110   int retval = -1;
00111   jboolean url_streaming;
00112   jstring jUrl = 0;
00113   try
00114   {
00115     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00116     jUrl = env->NewStringUTF(url);
00117     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00118     retval = env->CallIntMethod(mJavaProtoHandler, mJavaUrlOpen_mid, jUrl,
00119         flags);
00120     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00121     // delete your local refs, as this is a running inside another library that likely
00122     // is not returning to Java soon.
00123     url_streaming = env->CallBooleanMethod(mJavaProtoHandler,
00124         mJavaUrlIsStreamed_mid, jUrl, flags);
00125     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00126     if (url_streaming)
00127       h->is_streamed = 1;
00128     else
00129       h->is_streamed = 0;
00130 
00131   }
00132   catch (std::exception & e)
00133   {
00134     VS_LOG_TRACE("%s", e.what());
00135     retval = -1;
00136   }
00137   catch (...)
00138   {
00139     VS_LOG_DEBUG("Got unknown exception");
00140     retval = -1;
00141   }
00142   if (jUrl)
00143     env->DeleteLocalRef(jUrl);
00144 
00145   return retval;
00146 }
00147 
00148 int URLProtocolHandler::url_close(URLContext *)
00149 {
00150   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00151   int retval = -1;
00152   try
00153   {
00154     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00155     retval = env->CallIntMethod(mJavaProtoHandler, mJavaUrlClose_mid);
00156     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00157   }
00158   catch (std::exception & e)
00159   {
00160     VS_LOG_TRACE("%s", e.what());
00161     retval = -1;
00162   }
00163   catch (...)
00164   {
00165     VS_LOG_DEBUG("Got unknown exception");
00166     retval = -1;
00167   }
00168   return retval;
00169 }

00171 int64_t URLProtocolHandler::url_seek(URLContext *, int64_t position,
00172     int whence)
00173 {
00174   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00175   int64_t retval = -1;
00176 
00177   try
00178   {
00179     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00180     retval = env->CallLongMethod(mJavaProtoHandler, mJavaUrlSeek_mid, position,
00181       whence);
00182     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00183   }
00184   catch (std::exception & e)
00185   {
00186     VS_LOG_TRACE("%s", e.what());
00187     retval = -1;
00188   }
00189   catch (...)
00190   {
00191     VS_LOG_DEBUG("Got unknown exception");
00192     retval = -1;
00193   }
00194   return retval;
00195 }

00197 int URLProtocolHandler::url_read(URLContext *, unsigned char* buf, int size)
00198 {
00199   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00200   int retval = -1;
00201   jbyteArray byteArray = 0;
00202   
00203   try
00204   {
00205     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00206     byteArray = env->NewByteArray(size);
00207     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00208     // read into the Java byte array
00209     if (byteArray)
00210     {
00211       retval = env->CallIntMethod(mJavaProtoHandler, mJavaUrlRead_mid,
00212           byteArray, size);
00213       URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00214     }
00215     // now, copy into the C array, but only up to retval.
00216     if (retval > 0)
00217     {
00218       env->GetByteArrayRegion(byteArray, 0, retval, (jbyte*)buf);
00219       URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00220     }
00221   }
00222   catch (std::exception& e)
00223   {
00224     VS_LOG_TRACE("%s", e.what());
00225     retval = -1;
00226   }
00227   catch (...)
00228   {
00229     VS_LOG_DEBUG("Got unknown exception");
00230     retval = -1;
00231   }
00232   // delete your local refs, as this is a running inside another library that likely
00233   // is not returning to Java soon.
00234   if (byteArray)
00235     env->DeleteLocalRef(byteArray);
00236   return retval;
00237 }
00238 
00239 int URLProtocolHandler::url_write(URLContext *, const unsigned char* buf, int size)
00240 {
00241   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00242   int retval = -1;
00243   jbyteArray byteArray = 0;
00244 
00245   try
00246   {
00247     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00248     byteArray = env->NewByteArray(size);
00249     URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00250 
00251     // copy the data passed into the new java byteArray
00252     if (byteArray)
00253     {
00254       env->SetByteArrayRegion(byteArray, 0, size, (jbyte*)buf);
00255       URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00256 
00257       // write from the Java byte array
00258       retval = env->CallIntMethod(mJavaProtoHandler, mJavaUrlWrite_mid,
00259           byteArray, size);
00260       URLProtocolHandler_CheckException(env);
00261     }
00262   }
00263   catch (std::exception & e)
00264   {
00265     VS_LOG_TRACE("%s", e.what());
00266     retval = -1;
00267   }
00268   catch (...)
00269   {
00270     VS_LOG_DEBUG("Got unknown exception");
00271     retval = -1;
00272   }
00273 
00274   // delete your local refs, as this is a running inside another library that likely
00275   // is not returning to Java soon.
00276   if (byteArray)
00277     env->DeleteLocalRef(byteArray);
00278   return retval;
00279 }
